body:
Currently, nvCOMP is called to decompress ORC file footers that are compressed with ZSTD compression.
This is very likely slower than CPU decompression, especially with additional H2D and D2H copies.
We should investigate the perf gain from using a thrid party CPU library for this instead.

Otherwise, please respond with a comment indicating any updates or changes to the original issue and/or confirm this issue still needs to be addressed. title: Use CPU decompression for ORC footer with Zstandard compression
